skos:definition.span: A domain is a functional theme,
A Ticket represents a unit of work. Theoretically, every change to the system should be documented here.

ul.li: A fulfilled ticket is a record of the fulfilment of Issue via a Position, through some amount of work.
A ticket in progress is the intersection of a Issue and a Position.
A Ticket in its most basic form records an issue.

skos:definition.span: A unit of work in the codebase.
A test is an assertion about how the system should behave under given circumstances.

skos:scopeNote.span: This shouldn't be understood as an entire test, but rather a single assertion within that test. It's a specification of system behaviour.
RE: the question of atomaticity: we make no claims about how to draw the borders between suites, and simply model any existing data structure.

skos:definition.span: A test suite is the intersection of an ordered list of tests and related metadata.
A test run represents a particular run-through of a Test Suite.

skos:editorialNote.span: really no point in making one of these if you don't have a runner, a timestamp, and map over the tests in the test suite attaching passes and failures to them.
